detail: Spend at least 15-30 minutes each day studying English to maintain consistent progress.
Listen to music, podcasts, and watch movies or TV shows in English to improve your listening skills.
Read books, articles, and news in English to expand your vocabulary and improve your reading comprehension.
Practice speaking English with native speakers or language exchange partners to gain confidence and fluency.
Write essays, journals, or emails in English to improve your writing skills.
Use apps like Duolingo, Babbel, or Memrise to learn English interactively and fun.
Enroll in English courses, either in-person or online, to receive structured instruction and feedback.
Learn new words and phrases daily and use flashcards to practice.
Surround your environment with English as much as possible by changing the language of your devices and consuming content in English.
Learning a new language takes time and effort, so stay motivated and don't get discouraged by mistakes.
